structured.description: A configuration class `CorsConfig` that enables CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) functionality for a Spring Web MVC application. The `CorsConfig` class uses Spring's `@Configuration` annotation and sets up a `WebMvcConfigurer` bean to configure CORS mapping. The configuration specifies allowed origins, methods, headers, and credentials, allowing cross-origin requests from specified origins.

items.description: Configures Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) settings for a Spring MVC application. It allows origins specified in the configuration to access resources via a mapping of "/**". The class sets allowedOrigins, allowedMethods, allowedHeaders, exposedHeaders, and allowCredentials to enable secure communication.
items.name: CorsConfig

items.description: Configures CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) settings for a web application. It adds mapping to allow cross-origin resource sharing from any origin, allows all methods and headers, and specifies allowed origins, methods, and headers.

returns.description:
a configuration for CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) that allows requests from any origin to access resources from the server.

* `allowedOrigins`: an array of origins that are allowed to make requests to the server.
* `allowedMethods`: an array of methods that are allowed to be called on the server.
* `allowedHeaders`: an array of headers that are allowed to be used in responses.
* `exposedHeaders`: an array of headers that are exposed to clients in their responses.
* `allowCredentials`: a boolean value indicating whether credentials (e.g., cookies, authorization headers) should be allowed in requests.

items.name: corsConfigurer

items.description: Adds CORS mappings to a registry, allowing requests from any origin, method, and header, and exposing certain headers for authentication.

params.name: registry
params.description: CorsRegistry object that contains the mapping configuration for the API.

items.name: addCorsMappings
